section.p: This manual is a guide for Administrators of . It provides instructions on how to:
section.ul:
Add members to a group,
Manage group moderation,
Manage group members, and
Manage group properties.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Add members to [Group Name].

section.h: Add existing site members to a group

ol.li: Click on Select existing site members.
Choose one or more members from the list. Use the Control key to select multiple members.
Click the Add button.
Click on Enter the details of a new member.
Fill out the Email, First Name and Last Name fields. The Preferred Name field is optional.
You can choose to whether you want to Require member to verify?
Click the Create Member button.

The new member will receive an email message from
containing his or her login details.

tal:block.li: If you have left Require member to verify? ticked, the email will also require the new member to verify their email address. Unless the member verifies, he or she cannot participate in the online group.

section.p: Create Members in Bulk requires a CSV (Comma Separated Values) file. The CSV file must contain at least the first name, last name and email address of each member.

The creation of a large number of members may take a long time, and you may get a timeout. If this occurs, please do not retry until you have confirmed with the groupserver administrator that the members have not been created, otherwise double the number of members may be created. To reduce the chance of this happening, large numbers of users should be created in smaller batches (eg. 100 at a time).
Other profile values can be set at this time. Most of these are self-explanatory. See Viewing Your Profile in The User Maunal.

ol.li: Click on upload the details of multiple members using a CSV file.
Browse to the location of the CSV file on your local computer.
Set the column header for each user property you have included in your CSV file.
You can choose to whether you want to Require users to verify?
Click the Create Members button.

The new member will receive an email message from
containing his or her login details.

tal:block.li: If you have left Require members to verify? ticked, the email will also require the new member to verify their email address. Unless the member verifies, he or she cannot participate in the online group.

section.p: This page allows you to toggle moderation for the group. To specify moderators and moderated members, see the Manage Group Members section.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Manage group moderation, on the Group Administration page, to open the Manage Moderation page.

Choose
No moderation to allow all members of the group to post without approval.
Moderate specified members only to select specific members of the group to moderate.
Moderate specified members, and all new members that join [Group Name] to moderate all new members and any other members that you may specify.
Click the Change button.

section.p: On this page, you can remove members from the group, set the participation coach, and set the group administrator.
If moderation has been turned on for the group, you may also set moderators and moderated members. To toggle moderation on and off, see the Manage Moderation section.
Site administrators may also send verification reminders to unverified members from this page.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Manage the members of [Group Name], on the Group Administration page, to open the Manage Members page.

If you wish, you may then click on either List only the managers of [Group Name] to list only the Managers of the group, or if moderation has been turned on, List only the moderated members of [Group Name] to list only the moderated members of the group.
To set a member as Participation Coach, select the radio button labelled Make [Member Name] the participation coach.
To remove the current Participation Coach, select the radio button labelled Revoke participation coach status from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.
To set a member as a Group Administrator, check the box labelled Make [Member Name] a group administrator.
To remove a current Group Administrator, check the box labelled Revoke the administrator privilages from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.
To remove a member from the group, check the box labelled Remove [Member Name] from [Group Name].
Click the Change button.
With moderation turned on, check the box labelled Make [Member Name] a moderator for this group.
With moderation turned on, check the box labelled Revoke moderator status from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.
With moderation turned on, check the box labelled Start moderating messages from [Member Name].
With moderation turned on, check the box labelled Stop moderating messages from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.

section.p: Group Properties can be added and changed on this page. This is where the Online Groups Design is applied to the group.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Manage Group Properties, on the Group Administration page, to open the Manage Group Properties page.

section.p: You can set the Group Joinability so that the group can be joined by:

ul.li: Anyone, without approval — anyone can join
Anyone, pending approval — potential group members must apply to join
Only those invited — potential group members must be invited to joined to the group

section.p: To allow Anyone, without approval to join the the group.

ol.li: Set Group Visibility to either "Only division and group members" or "Everyone".
Set Joinability to "Anyone, without approval"

section.p: This puts the following text on the Groups' Home page.

ul.li: Logged out, 'Register and Join GroupName: if you already have an account on this site, please log in before joining (use this reminder to find out if you have one)'

section.p: To allow Anyone, pending approval to join the the group.

ol.li: Set Group Visibility to either "Only division and group members" or "Everyone".
Set Joinability to "Anyone, pending approval approval".

section.p: This puts the following text on the Groups' Home page.

ol.li: Logged in, 'Contact the Participation Coach 'Name' to request membership'.
Logged out, 'Contact the Participation Coach CoachName to request membership (you will have to register before you can see Participation Coach email address)'.

section.p: Setting Joinability to Only those invited puts the following text on the groups' home page, 'Visitors to GroupName can: Not join - membership of this group is by invitation only'.
